      Called internally to "connect" two Layer Observables taking care of other connection details such as passing the inference up the chain and any possible encoder.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Layer<T> Layer.add(<any> func)
      Adds a "generic" processing node into this Layer's processing chain.

      Adds an Anomaly computer to this Layer

      Layer<T> Layer.alterParameter(Parameters.KEY key, java.lang.Object value)
      Adds the ability to alter a given parameter in place during a fluent creation statement.
      Layer<T> Layer.close()
      Finalizes the initialization in one method call so that side effect operations to share objects and other special initialization tasks can happen all at once in a central place for maintenance ease.
      static Layer<?> Network.createLayer(java.lang.String name, Parameters p)
      Creates a Layer to hold algorithmic components and returns it.
      Layer<?> Region.getHead()
      Returns the top-most (last in execution order from bottom to top) Layer in this Region
      Layer<Inference> Layer.getNext()
      Returns the next Layer following this Layer in order of process flow.
      Layer<Inference> Layer.getPrevious()
      Returns the previous Layer preceding this Layer in order of process flow.
      Layer<?> Region.getTail()
      Returns the bottom-most (first in execution order from bottom to top) Layer in this Region
      Layer<T> Layer.increment()
      Increments the current record sequence number.
      Layer<?> Region.lookup(java.lang.String layerName)
      Does a straight associative lookup by first creating a composite key containing this Region's name concatenated with the specified Layer's name, and returning the result.
      (package private) Layer<T> Layer.name(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the name and returns this Layer.
      Layer<T> Layer.resetRecordNum()
      Resets the internal record count to zero
      Layer<T> Layer.skip(int count)
      Skips the specified count of records and internally alters the record sequence number.
      Layer<T> Layer.using(Connections c)
      Allows the user to define the Connections object data structure to use.
      Layer<T> Layer.using(Parameters p)
      Allows the user to specify the Parameters object used by this Layer.

      private boolean LayerTest.isWarmedUp(Layer<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> l, double anomalyScore)
      Checks the anomaly score against a known threshold which indicates that the TM predictions have been "warmed up".
      void Layer.next(Layer<Inference> l)
      Sets a pointer to the "next" Layer in this Layer's Observable sequence.

      Sets a pointer to the "previous" Layer in this Layer's Observable sequence.
